title: Connecting to Consensus Clients
body:
https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/getting-started/consensus-clients

I added these parameters by following the document. But I still get the same warning.

`--authrpc.addr localhost --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts localhost --authrpc.jwtsecret /tmp/jwtsecret`

Start With : `sudo geth --datadir /media/ubuntu/chain/data --port 30303  --syncmode "snap" --cache=4096 --http --metrics --maxpeers 30 --http.api "eth,personal,net,txpool,web3" --authrpc.addr localhost --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts localhost --authrpc.jwtsecret /tmp/jwtsecret`

#### Logs
```
WARN [02-21|13:17:48.191] Post-merge network, but no beacon client seen. Please launch one to follow the chain! 
INFO [02-21|13:17:53.537] Looking for peers                        peercount=1 tried=26 static=0
```

_Originally posted by @qraxiss in https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/26749#issuecomment-1438489965_
Do you run a consensus client? Which?
I suspect op just added some flags, but didn't actually run a consensus client. Closing
